docs.lead_paragraph: The retailer unveiled a plan intended to expand coverage and offer workers cheap prescription drugs.
docs.snippet: The retailer unveiled a plan intended to expand coverage and offer workers cheap prescription drugs.

docs.lead_paragraph: A MOVE TO RESTORE CONFIDENCE In an effort to stop the turmoil in the housing and financial markets from bringing down the overall economy, the Federal Reserve cut its benchmark interest rate by an unusually large one-half percentage point, to 4.75 percent from 5.25 percent. While the news that the Federal Reserve cut its benchmark interest rate by half a point was welcomed by many, the reaction was not universally upbeat. Economists and market specialists cautioned that the cut would take time to work through the system, and it may do little to help families confronted with rising mortgage payments and falling home prices. [C1.]

docs.lead_paragraph: Some of the Democratic contenders continue their appeals to everyday voters, as Senator Hillary Rodham Clinton of New York promotes her health-care ideas on the morning chat shows and through a Webcast tonight. And this seems like econ week for Senator Barack Obama of Illinois, who plans to outline a set of tax cuts for the middle class during a speech here in Washington this afternoon.
docs.abstract: Senator Obama outlines a tax-cut proposal while Senator Clinton takes questions on health care.
docs.snippet: Senator Obama outlines a tax-cut proposal while Senator Clinton takes questions on health care.

docs.lead_paragraph: A federal study shows that per capita spending in the lowest-spending state, Utah, was only 59 percent of that in Massachusetts, the highest-spending state.

docs.lead_paragraph: In the coming days and months, the wonk set -- on the right and the left (and, in fact in all places in between) -- as well as politicians -- will be parsing the details and scouring for the unmentioned potential pitfalls in Senator Hillary Rodham Clinton's just-released health care plan.
docs.abstract: Everyone on the right and the left (and, in fact in all places in between) will be parsing the details of the Clinton health plan.
